intro: Schistostephium heptalobum, commonly known as the seven-lobed cypress, is a member of the Cupressaceae family. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub native to the mountainous regions of eastern Africa. The plant is characterized by its narrow, scale-like leaves and its distinctive, rounded cones. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
